definitions.definition: Based on individual discretion or judgment; not based on any objective distinction, perhaps even made at random .
examples: Benjamin Franklin's designation of "positive" and "negative" to different charges was arbitrary .
The decision to use 18 years as the legal age of adulthood was arbitrary , as both age 17 and 19 were reasonable alternatives.

definitions.definition: Determined by impulse rather than reason ; often connoting heavy-handedness .
Any, out of all that are possible.
examples: The equation is true for an arbitrary value of x.

definitions.definition: Not representative or symbolic; not iconic .

main_definition: ( usually of a decision ) Based on individual discretion or judgment; not based on any objective distinction, perhaps even made at random .
secondary_definitions: Determined by impulse rather than reason ; often connoting heavy-handedness .
( mathematics ) Any, out of all that are possible.
( linguistics ) Not representative or symbolic; not iconic .
